project_longd: Servd is a responsive web application that manages the interactions between the customer and waiter to simplify communication and payment using the WorldPay API. The application has two separate views, one for the waiter and one for the customer. Using the application, restaurant waiters can manage lines, assign customers to table, and view alerts such as a customer requesting help or a customer payment. Customers on the other hand can use the application to send a request if they need help, pay for the meal, and rate their server. Ultimately, the restaurant business is a service focused, industry where customer-employee interaction is key to satisfying both parties, and this interaction is what we are improving.

project_longd: Problem: Difficulty faced by visuially impaired people to make debit transactions at POS without saying out the card PIN to the cashier as the POS systems provide no accessibility to them. None of the current cash transaction apps provide accessiblilty to the visually impaired population. Inspite of niche products such as Apple pay, android pay, touch ID there is still a huge gap when it comes to reality. Not many people could afford smartphones with touchID sensors Aim: Provide a user friendly, hassle-free & secure way of carrying out debit transactions at POS. Enable the visually impaired population to enjoy to advantages of the mobile payment or digital wallet services. Solution A minimalistic mobile app that seamlessly provides the functionality of a digital wallet to the visually impaired. An intuitive app that uses voice commands and braille pattern (on the phone covers) on the phone screen as the input. Providing a system that maintains a wallet for the merchant and the user. Each user would be identified via a cellphone number.
project_description: Accessible mobile wallet to the visually challenged

project_longd: Have you ever gone to a local shop or restaurant but did not know if your credit card or bitcoin transactions were secure. Omnitrust solves this problem by identifying merchants who are PCI compliant. What this means to the customer is that their information is protected and safeguarded from fraudulent activity. Just like Waze, it can tell you which merchant to avoid and lets you see who is compliant. But if you really want to go to that merchant and itÉ??s red, we recommend cash only. But if you can avoid it, please do so. Omnitrust does not want you to hit a roadblock because we will give you a lot more options. So donÉ??t worry. We are here to guide you to the right merchant. For the merchants who are in compliant, we will increase visibility, enhanced marketing to attract more customers and increase sales. Merchants can also know if a customer is a risk on the purchase in real-time. How do we do this? Omnitrust has a cloud platform, mobile app as well as ibeacon identifiers. We have implemented a proprietary authentication algorithm which incorporates multiple fraud and risk parameters to return highly effective information for the customers and merchants. Having a peace of mind for a seamless and secure purchasing experience is priceless.

You know the list É?? your kids' teachers, the neighbour who's always so forthcoming with the suggestions on gardening, your 12 year old nephew you hardly ever see. Enter GiftHero. We give you personalized gift card suggestions for everyone in your network - based on that persons' actual purchasing behavior - where they shop, what they search for, and what they buy - both on and offline. Tell us who you're looking to give to - and get a top 5 suggested merchants list. Click and send that gift card instantly- and when you use your payment card, we'll give 5% cash back. In addition, you'll know what items consumers add to their shopping cart and change their mind--you'll have the opportunity to deliver a coupon during their shopping experience to change their mind. project_tech: Android Bluetooth Low Energy Modules Feedzai api Multitool Hot Water custom hardware
project_longd: Someone steals your wallet. No problem--your phone alerts you within 10 seconds because of our tiny (6mm x 6mm) custom-hacked $2 receiver placed in the wallet. Swipe right to go into lockdown mode: (1) Immediately blacklist your stolen cards for participating merchants using the Feedzai API. (2) Alert merchants on Feedzai if a swiped or typed card is stolen, saving them the costs of both online and offline credit card fraud ($3.5 billion in 2013!). (3) Deactivate the stolen cards by traversing the automated call list using Twilio. The leading wallet-protection device, Tile, uses a device 40x bigger and 12x more expensive than ours. Tile can be easily removed by a thief, it doesn't protect your cards, and doesn't protect merchants. To make the Locket receiver, we hacked an electronic tag with hot coffee (to melt the glue) and the Braintree swag (to crack the case and pry the sucker out). It is based on the CC2540 Bluetooth low energy System-on-Chip. It uses minimal battery and is compatible with major Apple and Android devices. #LocketAndChill #MakeAmericaSafeAgain
project_description: We solved credit card theft and fraud with $2

project_longd: We protect credit cards and customer accounts with 3D biometric, voice, and motion authentication. Using Natural Language understanding and 3D technology, we also provide a highly individualized shopping experience for everyone.

project_longd: Chain Cards is on a mission to accelerate BTC adoption, with a focus on the Millenial and Gen Z groups. We seek to augment BTC adoption by creating Blockchain-backed digital assets that users will cherish and interact with on a daily basis. In addition to creating original assets, Chain Cards is a publishing house for other entities that wish to sell or crowdsource digital goods using the Blockchain as a record of ownership. Tournameme is demonstration of Chain Cards at play. It's a simple, hilarious social game played with virtual cards that have user ownership coded into the Blockchain. Users choose packs of champion cards (like Cat Memes) to enter into tournaments. Tournaments consist of tongue in cheek challenges such as "Who would win in a duel where both parties are wielding swordfish?" The whole Tournameme community may vote for the participating champion that most deserves this ridiculous accolade. Winners and losers alike will get satisfaction in seeing the silly champion match-ups and challenges.

Pop open the Switch Chrome extension right before checking out, click "apply," and let Switch handle the rest É?? it'll buy discounted gift cards on your behalf and apply them right to your cart. project_longd: Imagine shopping in-store in the year 2020. No need to carry items in a physical shopping cart, no need to carry a physical wallet. PayWise is a mobile app that brings the future of the in-store shopping experience to you. We create an end-to-end payment experience using the optimized payment methods based on the goals you have and rules you set. The goals can be anything from improving your credit score, maximizing cash flow, avoiding overdrafts, to maximizing credit rewards. Or you could also create your own IFTTT rules that automatically define how you transact. All you need to do is to link your financial accounts, create rules, and scan the items you want to buy. PayWise recommends the optimal way for you to pay across your different sources, using a combination of payment sources. Without hassle, you simply get the app-generated barcode scanned by the cashier. Boom, you're done. PayWise. We optimize the way you pay based on the rules you set.
project_description: Optimize the way you pay, with automated IFTTT rules

project_longd: Amongst the two of us (12th graders), we've spent nearly US$ 7000 on career counselling and college admission guidance. We think that's a huge problem, as it creates a fundamental gap in accessibility of resources, something we personally believe is unjust and must be bridged. That's where we come in. UniConnection aims to bridge that gap by bypassing the third party; it connects high-schoolers directly to students of the institution they wish to gain admission to. Thus, it allows all high school students a cheap, highly effective alternative to expensive counselling programs many cannot afford straight from someone in a similar age group with first-hand experience, and it offers University students an alternative, convenient source of income. It also eliminates the middleman by enabling payment directly to and from the concerned parties. Even though fundamental tuition is accessible to almost all individuals, there are numerous other factors that promote a chasm of inequality in educational opportunities amongst students. UniConnection is the first step towards changing that.

project_longd: CareemPlus inspired by Careem and built for Careem's services is an app made for the captains that contribute in making Careem the successful business that it is today. We aim to solve some of the challenges proposed by the folks at Careem. CareemPlus includes the following features: -Landmark Highlighting: (Solves/Improves: Passenger Routing ) This feature pinpoints the closest and most renowned landmarks around the passenger's pickup location. This not only makes it easier and more hassle free for our captains but our passengers too. -Captain Authorization: (Solves: Identity Theft, Improves: Safety) This feature makes use of biometric data (eg: Fingerprints) and allows our captains to verify their identity ensuring the safety of our vehicles, captains and most importantly our passengers. -An EventHub section: (Solves: Lack of passengers) This section displays all the important happenings of the city with a time, date and location. This feature enables our Captains to find a multitude of passengers especially since these events generate a lot of traffic. N.B: Another feature which is currently a work in progress (unable to complete due to time constraints) is a mass broadcasting dispatch system. We at CareemPlus plan on implementing this using Parse (Mobile Backend/DB) and Javascript Cloudcode. This feature would allow captains to warn other captains of traffic jams/accidents and which roads to avoid. This feature would also allow the folks at CareemPlus HeadQuarters to send important updates and messages to our captains synchronously

project_longd: Diner Roulette is a growing trend in restaurant-dense neighborhoods. In order to reduce their wait, customers put their names on the waitlist for many restaurants at once and then wait for a call from the first available one. The remaining restaurants are often stuck trying to reach this person, who is no longer interested in their business, before seating others - costing them time and reducing the accuracy of their wait time estimates. https://bitbucket.org/ah_cincy_mesa Mesa is a product aiming to solve this problem. The central component is a waitlist management app used by the hosting team of each restaurant. This app allows the hosting team to add new reservations, notify customers of table availability, and mark customers as being seated to close the reservation and remove that customer from ALL connected wait lists at other restaurants. Removing seated customers will allow for increased wait time estimations and allow more flexibility in preferential seating for all of the restaurants using Mesa. Analysis of the data collected can be used to improve restaurant operations and customer marketing / retention programs. From the customer side, a mobile app allows them to search for restaurants in a given area and be presented with a list containing basic restaurant details, price range / rating indicators, and current estimated wait times. Customers can then check in remotely (if the restaurant allows), review the remaining wait time, and receive notifications from the restaurants.

project_longd: We built a system to allow for secure legal transactions over traditional document sharing platforms, such as Google Docs. To do this, we tackled two problems: user verification and disabling nefarious users. We verify the user via a thumbprint scan from their iPhone. We then limit untrustworthy users by storing sql databases locally on each user's computer while also storing a master sql database online. In order to guarantee transactions, multiple databases are referenced forming a blockchain.

project_longd: New roommates want to fully stock their new apartment with dishes, appliances, and furniture, but it's tough to know who has the best couch, who has a full set of nice dishes, and who just has a nice smile. Enter MiMo, a service that allows new roommates to quickly and easily list what they already have. 1.) Using this information, MiMo compiles a shopping cart of necessary items. In one easy step, the group can buy all the necessities for a new apartment based on their stated budget. MiMo will be delay sending the order if necessary so that the items can be delivered to the new apartment on a specified day. 2.) Upon moving out, roommates can use MiMo to bid on household items that they want to take with them. MiMo will use each roommate's preferences to draw up a sheet of who pays what to whom, and who gets the nice couch. Full Clickable Prototype: http://invis.io/3Z3JDO9Q2

comment_1: I want to address my team's demo. Please keep in mind (I'm looking at you, Mr. Jason Wisdom), I am on 1hr and half sleep the last two days. Not to be used as an excuse but it should be put out there. I'll go ahead and say it. I'm NOT a coder. I'm a designer. However, I DID have a full click enabled prototype ready for the team to present. My fellow teammates had no desire to show it even though it looked more finished than their actual coding. http://invis.io/3Z3JDO9Q2 is the link that was supposed to be shown and I would have been happy to have presented. I've presented ad campaigns before so this seemed no different to me. But because this was another team member's idea and he felt it necessary to make changes up until literally the last minute : he delivered an entire different "scenario" than the one I was told. Also Amazon was the original API that was going to be used. Where craigslist came from who knows. I certainly wasn't in the loop. And frankly neither was the guy working on the API stuff as far as the design process goes. This is where the entire disconnection comes into play concerning the demo. If I sound frustrated, I certainly am. I am happy to have furthered my knowledge in UX design, Sketch 3 and InVisionApp and I love the design I did before it was butchered but I will never do a code based hackathon again after this experience.

project_tech: node.js Angular.js HTML5 Python Flask bluemix Cluster point
project_longd: There exist dozens upon dozens of event-planning companies that make event planning incredibly easy. Facebook and eventbrite events are great for big events like birthdays, anniversaries, even weddings. But, what about those 'low-key' events that don't need such rigorous event planning? What about food? I'm hungry, and I don't want to go alone; but I also don't want to message everyone. What about basketball at 7? There are tons of events that are too small to make a big deal about; these are exactly the activities that can be reached through this application. This application would be able to be added onto existing networks, like contact lists, or facebook friends, or twitter feeds (or really anything). You would be able to compile groups of friends (circles), and post these lowkey events to them. For example, with the food aspect of this application, you can submit your position, or where you're going to be, and your general hunger level. And people would be able to basically add on to it, and check off if they want to come. The post would remain up for a while, but would go down after a few hours (or as soon as the event happened). Anyone can join!
comment_2: Good handling of Q&A. In spite of tech issues- applaud you for taking a risk and trying something new
comment_1: Kind of a neat concept. The demo showing looks very basic...not sure what it is supposed to do. Also, 1 minute to create a FB group is not a lot of time. Why would I learn an entire new platform just to save 50 seconds?
project_description: Low-key events organization (i.e. food and sports)
